--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est clbre pour son immense parc (parc dpartemental de Sceaux, dessin par Andr Le Ntre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant chteau fut dtruit sous le Consulat.

Ce chteau fut la rsidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le chteau de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, difi par le deuxime duc de Trvise, fils du marchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style no - Louis XIII.

Le chteau actuel abrite le muse de la rgion le-de-France. Ce muse possde l'une des plus importantes collections d'uvres de peintres franais figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre uvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le muse est complt par un centre de documentation spcialis sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la rgion.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Chteau of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc dpartemental de Sceaux), designed by Andr Le Ntre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original chteau, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present chteau, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of le-de-France open for visits.

Hong Kong - Aerial View http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5208/5299340791_6aeacd24c8_s.jpg Quick snap from the airplane while arriving at Hong Kong on Dec. 28th 2010. Lower left is a section of Hong Kong Island (Central to Wanchai), about middle right is Kowloon (Tsim Sha Tsui and West Kowloon). Upper left Tsing Yi Island, the Rambler Channel and Tsuen Wan.

Pretty clear air, but still needed some PP to really clean it up.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /lndn/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. It is a 51.509517, -0.016565 Tunnel, Light, Poplar, Docklands, Architecture poplar2010, artofimages, bestcapturesaoi, greatphotographers, Colors, Blue

Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page

Please press "L" for the best view!

--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est clbre pour son immense parc (parc dpartemental de Sceaux, dessin par Andr Le Ntre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant chteau fut dtruit sous le Consulat.

Ce chteau fut la rsidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le chteau de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, difi par le deuxime duc de Trvise, fils du marchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style no - Louis XIII.

Le chteau actuel abrite le muse de la rgion le-de-France. Ce muse possde l'une des plus importantes collections d'uvres de peintres franais figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre uvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le muse est complt par un centre de documentation spcialis sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la rgion.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Chteau of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc dpartemental de Sceaux), designed by Andr Le Ntre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original chteau, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present chteau, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of le-de-France open for visits.

Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page
Push there the  "Like Button" and  enjoy my pictures and much, much more! ;)   
Click this link:Oliver Botor Photography

Please press "L" for the best view!




































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































All of the pictures are  copyright by Oliver Botor "All rights are reserved" worldwide.

with me if you are interested in using any of my images.









--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est clbre pour son immense parc (parc dpartemental de Sceaux, dessin par Andr Le Ntre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant chteau fut dtruit sous le Consulat.

Ce chteau fut la rsidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le chteau de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, difi par le deuxime duc de Trvise, fils du marchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style no - Louis XIII.

Le chteau actuel abrite le muse de la rgion le-de-France. Ce muse possde l'une des plus importantes collections d'uvres de peintres franais figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre uvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le muse est complt par un centre de documentation spcialis sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la rgion.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Chteau of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc dpartemental de Sceaux), designed by Andr Le Ntre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original chteau, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present chteau, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of le-de-France open for visits.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

TWITTER | WWW.DAVIDGUTIERREZ.CO.UK |  SAATCHI ONLINE | YOUTUBE | FACEBOOK | REDBUBBLE 




 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /lndn/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. It is a 51.509517, -0.016565 Tunnel, Light, Poplar, Docklands, Architecture poplar2010, artofimages, bestcapturesaoi, greatphotographers, Colors, Blue

Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Chteau of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc dpartemental de Sceaux), designed by Andr Le Ntre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original chteau, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present chteau, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of le-de-France open for visits.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /lndn/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. It is a 51.509517, -0.016565 Tunnel, Light, Poplar, Docklands, Architecture poplar2010, artofimages, bestcapturesaoi, greatphotographers, Colors, Blue

Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page

--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est clbre pour son immense parc (parc dpartemental de Sceaux, dessin par Andr Le Ntre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant chteau fut dtruit sous le Consulat.

Ce chteau fut la rsidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le chteau de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, difi par le deuxime duc de Trvise, fils du marchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style no - Louis XIII.

Le chteau actuel abrite le muse de la rgion le-de-France. Ce muse possde l'une des plus importantes collections d'uvres de peintres franais figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre uvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le muse est complt par un centre de documentation spcialis sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la rgion.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Chteau of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc dpartemental de Sceaux), designed by Andr Le Ntre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original chteau, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present chteau, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of le-de-France open for visits.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /lndn/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page
Push there the  "Like Button" and  enjoy my pictures and much, much more! ;)

Please press "L" for the best view!

--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est clbre pour son immense parc (parc dpartemental de Sceaux, dessin par Andr Le Ntre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant chteau fut dtruit sous le Consulat.

Ce chteau fut la rsidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le chteau de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, difi par le deuxime duc de Trvise, fils du marchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style no - Louis XIII.

Le chteau actuel abrite le muse de la rgion le-de-France. Ce muse possde l'une des plus importantes collections d'uvres de peintres franais figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre uvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le muse est complt par un centre de documentation spcialis sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la rgion.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Chteau of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc dpartemental de Sceaux), designed by Andr Le Ntre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original chteau, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present chteau, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of le-de-France open for visits.

Lower left is a section of Hong Kong Island (Central to Wanchai), about middle right is Kowloon (Tsim Sha Tsui and West Kowloon). Upper left Tsing Yi Island, the Rambler Channel and Tsuen Wan.

Shanghai | Hazy Lujiazui - PuDong, Shanghai http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5286/5236424710_ae1a3211be_s.jpg The towers of Lujiazui Finance and Trade Zone () at PuDong, Shanghai() - seen from The Bund.

My Shanghai Set | My Photostream

The beautiful Shanghai is plagued by pollution.  It is rather hard to have a good view of the buildings in PuDong during the Summer, you'd have to be lucky for the right shot.


View on black.

You can mouse over the buildings to see their name.  If there is anything wrong, please make a change.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

TIA INTERNATIONAL PHOTOGRAPHY / TIA Facebook / TIA Twitter 22.268997, 114.150073 Hong Kong, China, East, Asia, Pacific, Victoria, Peak, metropolis, architecture, cosmopolitan

TWITTER | WWW.DAVIDGUTIERREZ.CO.UK |  SAATCHI ONLINE | YOUTUBE | FACEBOOK | REDBUBBLE 




 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /lndn/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. It is a 51.509517, -0.016565 Tunnel, Light, Poplar, Docklands, Architecture poplar2010, artofimages, bestcapturesaoi, greatphotographers, Colors, Blue

A crowd drawer  during the 13th Annual Winter Walk at the town of Hudson, New York.

8:47 pm - Frankfurt am Main http://farm3.static.flickr.com/2491/4099891265_50b08bb7db_s.jpg Get   here    a large view!
www.wolfgangstaudt.de

Frankfurt am Main ist mit ber 667.000 Einwohnern die grte Stadt Hessens und nach Berlin, Hamburg, Mnchen und Kln die fnftgrte Deutschlands.

Seit dem Mittelalter gehrt Frankfurt zu den bedeutendsten urbanen Zentren Deutschlands. 794 erstmals urkundlich erwhnt, war es seit dem Hochmittelalter Freie Reichsstadt und bis 1806 Wahl- und Krnungsstadt der rmisch-deutschen Kaiser. Von 1816 bis 1866 war Frankfurt Sitz des Deutschen Bundes und 1848/49 des ersten frei gewhlten deutschen Parlaments.

Heute ist Frankfurt ein bedeutendes europisches Finanz-, Messe- und Dienstleistungszentrum. Die Stadt ist Sitz der Europischen Zentralbank, der Deutschen Bundesbank, der Frankfurter Wertpapierbrse und der Frankfurter Messe. Durch ihre zentrale Lage gehrt sie mit dem Frankfurter Flughafen, dem Hauptbahnhof und dem Frankfurter Kreuz zu den wichtigsten Verkehrsknotenpunkten Europas.

1875 zhlte Frankfurt erstmals ber 100.000, 1928 zum ersten Mal mehr als 500.000 Einwohner. In der engeren Stadtregion leben heute etwa 1,8 Millionen, im gesamten Rhein-Main-Gebiet 5,8 Millionen Einwohner. Frankfurt ist damit das Zentrum der nach dem Ballungsraum Rhein-Ruhr zweitgrten deutschen Metropolregion.

Eine Besonderheit Frankfurts ist die Skyline, deren Wolkenkratzer zu den hchsten Gebuden Europas gehren.


From  Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia 50.112041, 8.68342 Wolfgang, Staudt, Frankfurt, Skyscrapers, Lindner, Frankfurt am Main, Hessen, Germany, River Main, Skyline

Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page
Push there the  "Like Button" and  enjoy my pictures and much, much more! ;)   
Click this link:Oliver Botor Photography

Please press "L" for the best view!




































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































All of the pictures are  copyright by Oliver Botor "All rights are reserved" worldwide. 
Please do not use, copy or edit any of my photographs. However please feel free to contact 
with me if you are interested in using any of my images.









--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est clbre pour son immense parc (parc dpartemental de Sceaux, dessin par Andr Le Ntre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant chteau fut dtruit sous le Consulat.

Ce chteau fut la rsidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le chteau de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, difi par le deuxime duc de Trvise, fils du marchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style no - Louis XIII.

Le chteau actuel abrite le muse de la rgion le-de-France. Ce muse possde l'une des plus importantes collections d'uvres de peintres franais figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre uvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le muse est complt par un centre de documentation spcialis sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la rgion.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Chteau of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc dpartemental de Sceaux), designed by Andr Le Ntre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original chteau, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present chteau, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of le-de-France open for visits.

Hong Kong - Aerial View http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5208/5299340791_6aeacd24c8_s.jpg Quick snap from the airplane while arriving at Hong Kong on Dec. 28th 2010. Lower left is a section of Hong Kong Island (Central to Wanchai), about middle right is Kowloon (Tsim Sha Tsui and West Kowloon). Upper left Tsing Yi Island, the Rambler Channel and Tsuen Wan.

Shanghai | Hazy Lujiazui - PuDong, Shanghai http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5286/5236424710_ae1a3211be_s.jpg The towers of Lujiazui Finance and Trade Zone () at PuDong, Shanghai() - seen from The Bund.

My Shanghai Set | My Photostream

The beautiful Shanghai is plagued by pollution.  It is rather hard to have a good view of the buildings in PuDong during the Summer, you'd have to be lucky for the right shot.


View on black.

You can mouse over the buildings to see their name.  If there is anything wrong, please make a change.

3000 views at 2/1/11!! 31.245535, 121.482353 Shanghai, PuDong, , , , , , China, Skyline, PuXi

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

TIA INTERNATIONAL PHOTOGRAPHY / TIA Facebook / TIA Twitter 22.268997, 114.150073 Hong Kong, China, East, Asia, Pacific, Victoria, Peak, metropolis, architecture, cosmopolitan

 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /lndn/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page
Push there the  "Like Button" and  enjoy my pictures and much, much more! ;)   
Click this link:Oliver Botor Photography

Please press "L" for the best view!

--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est clbre pour son immense parc (parc dpartemental de Sceaux, dessin par Andr Le Ntre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant chteau fut dtruit sous le Consulat.

Ce chteau fut la rsidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le chteau de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, difi par le deuxime duc de Trvise, fils du marchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style no - Louis XIII.

Le chteau actuel abrite le muse de la rgion le-de-France. Ce muse possde l'une des plus importantes collections d'uvres de peintres franais figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre uvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le muse est complt par un centre de documentation spcialis sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la rgion.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Chteau of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc dpartemental de Sceaux), designed by Andr Le Ntre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original chteau, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present chteau, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of le-de-France open for visits.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

London (pronounced /lndn/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page
Push there the  "Like Button" and  enjoy my pictures and much, much more! ;)   
Click this link:Oliver Botor Photography

Please press "L" for the best view!

--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est clbre pour son immense parc (parc dpartemental de Sceaux, dessin par Andr Le Ntre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant chteau fut dtruit sous le Consulat.

Ce chteau fut la rsidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le chteau de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, difi par le deuxime duc de Trvise, fils du marchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style no - Louis XIII.

Le chteau actuel abrite le muse de la rgion le-de-France. Ce muse possde l'une des plus importantes collections d'uvres de peintres franais figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre uvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le muse est complt par un centre de documentation spcialis sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la rgion.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Chteau of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc dpartemental de Sceaux), designed by Andr Le Ntre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original chteau, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present chteau, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of le-de-France open for visits.

Shanghai | Hazy Lujiazui - PuDong, Shanghai http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5286/5236424710_ae1a3211be_s.jpg The towers of Lujiazui Finance and Trade Zone () at PuDong, Shanghai() - seen from The Bund.

The beautiful Shanghai is plagued by pollution.  It is rather hard to have a good view of the buildings in PuDong during the Summer, you'd have to be lucky for the right shot.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

TIA INTERNATIONAL PHOTOGRAPHY / TIA Facebook / TIA Twitter 22.268997, 114.150073 Hong Kong, China, East, Asia, Pacific, Victoria, Peak, metropolis, architecture, cosmopolitan

TWITTER | WWW.DAVIDGUTIERREZ.CO.UK |  SAATCHI ONLINE | YOUTUBE | FACEBOOK | REDBUBBLE 




 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /lndn/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. It is a 51.509517, -0.016565 Tunnel, Light, Poplar, Docklands, Architecture poplar2010, artofimages, bestcapturesaoi, greatphotographers, Colors, Blue

Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page
Push there the  "Like Button" and  enjoy my pictures and much, much more! ;)   
Click this link:Oliver Botor Photography

Please press "L" for the best view!




































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































All of the pictures are  copyright by Oliver Botor "All rights are reserved" worldwide.

with me if you are interested in using any of my images.









--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est clbre pour son immense parc (parc dpartemental de Sceaux, dessin par Andr Le Ntre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant chteau fut dtruit sous le Consulat.

Ce chteau fut la rsidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le chteau de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, difi par le deuxime duc de Trvise, fils du marchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style no - Louis XIII.

Le chteau actuel abrite le muse de la rgion le-de-France. Ce muse possde l'une des plus importantes collections d'uvres de peintres franais figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre uvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le muse est complt par un centre de documentation spcialis sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la rgion.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Chteau of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc dpartemental de Sceaux), designed by Andr Le Ntre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original chteau, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present chteau, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of le-de-France open for visits.

Hong Kong - Aerial View http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5208/5299340791_6aeacd24c8_s.jpg Quick snap from the airplane while arriving at Hong Kong on Dec. 28th 2010. Lower left is a section of Hong Kong Island (Central to Wanchai), about middle right is Kowloon (Tsim Sha Tsui and West Kowloon). Upper left Tsing Yi Island, the Rambler Channel and Tsuen Wan.

Shanghai | Hazy Lujiazui - PuDong, Shanghai http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5286/5236424710_ae1a3211be_s.jpg The towers of Lujiazui Finance and Trade Zone () at PuDong, Shanghai() - seen from The Bund.

The beautiful Shanghai is plagued by pollution.  It is rather hard to have a good view of the buildings in PuDong during the Summer, you'd have to be lucky for the right shot.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

TWITTER | WWW.DAVIDGUTIERREZ.CO.UK |  SAATCHI ONLINE | YOUTUBE | FACEBOOK | REDBUBBLE 




 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /lndn/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. It is a 51.509517, -0.016565 Tunnel, Light, Poplar, Docklands, Architecture poplar2010, artofimages, bestcapturesaoi, greatphotographers, Colors, Blue

Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page
Push there the  "Like Button" and  enjoy my pictures and much, much more! ;)   
Click this link:Oliver Botor Photography

Please press "L" for the best view!




































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































All of the pictures are  copyright by Oliver Botor "All rights are reserved" worldwide. 
Please do not use, copy or edit any of my photographs. However please feel free to contact 
with me if you are interested in using any of my images.









--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est clbre pour son immense parc (parc dpartemental de Sceaux, dessin par Andr Le Ntre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant chteau fut dtruit sous le Consulat.

Ce chteau fut la rsidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le chteau de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, difi par le deuxime duc de Trvise, fils du marchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style no - Louis XIII.

Le chteau actuel abrite le muse de la rgion le-de-France. Ce muse possde l'une des plus importantes collections d'uvres de peintres franais figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre uvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le muse est complt par un centre de documentation spcialis sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la rgion.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Chteau of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc dpartemental de Sceaux), designed by Andr Le Ntre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original chteau, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present chteau, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of le-de-France open for visits.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /lndn/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. It is a 51.509517, -0.016565 Tunnel, Light, Poplar, Docklands, Architecture poplar2010, artofimages, bestcapturesaoi, greatphotographers, Colors, Blue

If you like this, check out the New York Skyline - the original Gotham City.

Feel free to add a note if you recognize any building on the skyline.

A crowd drawer  during the 13th Annual Winter Walk at the town of Hudson, New York.
These mamas surely know how to use what their mamas gave them. 
Even young people stayed watching for a while.
It was snowing very hard and was cold outside the street.

The festival was participated by many business owners and residents.
This street of Warren is home to many art galleries and antique shops aside from banking and finance, restaurant, boutiques and shops.

 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /lndn/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. FastBill ist schlank, intuitiv und hilft bei wichtigen Aufgaben. Schlu mit nerviger Brokratie.  Mobil fr rumliche und zeitliche Freiheit. Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page
Push there the  "Like Button" and  enjoy my pictures and much, much more! ;)   
Click this link:Oliver Botor Photography

Please press "L" for the best view!

with me if you are interested in using any of my images.









--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est clbre pour son immense parc (parc dpartemental de Sceaux, dessin par Andr Le Ntre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant chteau fut dtruit sous le Consulat.

Ce chteau fut la rsidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le chteau de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, difi par le deuxime duc de Trvise, fils du marchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style no - Louis XIII.

Le chteau actuel abrite le muse de la rgion le-de-France. Ce muse possde l'une des plus importantes collections d'uvres de peintres franais figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre uvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le muse est complt par un centre de documentation spcialis sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la rgion.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Chteau of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc dpartemental de Sceaux), designed by Andr Le Ntre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original chteau, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present chteau, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of le-de-France open for visits.

Lower left is a section of Hong Kong Island (Central to Wanchai), about middle right is Kowloon (Tsim Sha Tsui and West Kowloon). Upper left Tsing Yi Island, the Rambler Channel and Tsuen Wan.

Shanghai | Hazy Lujiazui - PuDong, Shanghai http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5286/5236424710_ae1a3211be_s.jpg The towers of Lujiazui Finance and Trade Zone () at PuDong, Shanghai() - seen from The Bund.

My Shanghai Set | My Photostream

The beautiful Shanghai is plagued by pollution.  It is rather hard to have a good view of the buildings in PuDong during the Summer, you'd have to be lucky for the right shot.


View on black.

You can mouse over the buildings to see their name.  If there is anything wrong, please make a change.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

TIA INTERNATIONAL PHOTOGRAPHY / TIA Facebook / TIA Twitter 22.268997, 114.150073 Hong Kong, China, East, Asia, Pacific, Victoria, Peak, metropolis, architecture, cosmopolitan
